channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Streetlights failed again adjacent to 280 Long Lane N3 2RN, 1st February
item.description:
Streetlights 319e and 320e have failed again.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road contaminated with mud and litter, 1st February
item.description:
There is a build-up of mud, rubbish and debris on the carriageway. This is causing vehicles and pedestrians to get dirty when getting in and out of cars and could become slippery in wet weather. The issue appears to be ongoing and requires cleaning to restore the road to a safe and clean condition.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poo that looks human, 1st February
item.description:
This is big and right behind play structure for children. It’s a biohazard and looks human sadly.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millard Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches falling of the tree outside 72 Woodbastwick, 1st February
item.description:
Lots and I mean lots of small branches that constantly fall from the tree outside 72 Woodbastwick Rd. Need collecting. Not seen a Rd sweeper in a long time. Have in Kent house rd but they have not turnt into Woodbastwick Rd. These branches are a pain as on the pavement you can easily trip over them and people them kick them into Rd. A nice collection now outside 72 Woodbastwick Rd.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodbastwick Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped batteries, 1st February
item.description:
In the night someone dumped a large number of batteries by my wall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfield Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris across road pot hole drain sticking out, 1st February
item.description:
3 drains on the road have massive pot holes. Chunks of debris are across the road. It's very dangerous. Hard to avoid if oncoming traffic and it does not help with temp traffic lights and traffic backing up so can't always avoid them. These have previously been reported 2 weeks ago but is still outstanding. There are chunks of debris across the road and pavement. There is a busstop there so it will keep getting worse. The drain is sticking out the ground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous pot holes, 1st February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broomhill Rise, Bexley, Greater London

item.title: Historical flytip, 1st February
item.description:
This stinking mess has been accumulating for nearly 3 months. Each day more rubbish is added and rats have been seen in daylight.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chatterton Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trenches sinking where new road refuge was installed, 1st February
item.description:
The works to install the new road refuge involved digging trenches and the road reinstatement has sunk since this work was done leaving a sunken trench right across the road. Been developing for several months now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Centre Common Road, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole getting bigger and bigger in road along Royal Parade, 1st February
item.description:
Pot hole has developed in road and is getting bigger due to recent snow and heavy rain. Trench in road from pelican crossing works has sunk and reinstatement was not fit for purpose. Has been sinking for months since works were completed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Parade, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 black bags fly tipped outside my house, 1st February
item.description:
This is a hazard to pedestrians as it is on a busy thoroughfare. Outside no90. Was deposited by someone on Thursday morning, which was bin day. There are a few flats with overflowing bins in the locality so unsure if it’s another resident trying is dispose of extra rubbish .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Crayford, Greater London
